com.symbol.emdk.notification

Class NotificationDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.symbol.emdk.notification.NotificationDevice

  • public class NotificationDevice
extends Object
    NotificationDevice class will represent and provides access to the physical notification device instance. This can be used with a connected notification device. Once RS6000 is disconnected, current instance cannot be used any longer, therefore it must be released using NotificationDevice.release() method. When connected again, you must use NotificationManager.getDevice() method to get a new notification device object for RS6000.

    • Method Detail

      • getDeviceInfo

        public DeviceInfo getDeviceInfo()
        Returns information about the notification device.
        Returns:
        Returns the DeviceInfo object.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns whether the notification device is connected to the Mobile device or not.
        Returns:
        true if it is connected else false.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns whether the notification device is enabled or not.
        Returns:
        true if it is enabled else false.

      • enable

        public void enable()
            throws NotificationException
        Enables the notification device. This opens the communication port to send the notifications to the devices. You must call disable() when you are done. 

         Example Usage:
 device.enable();
        Throws:
        NotificationException - The exception will be thrown if the notification device enable fails.

      • disable

        public void disable()
             throws NotificationException
        Disables the notification device. This closes the communication port. 

         Example Usage:
 device.disable();
        Throws:
        NotificationException - The exception will be thrown if the notification device disable fails.

      • notify

        public void notify(Notification notification)
            throws NotificationException
        This sends the notification information to the device. 

         Example Usage:
 		Notification notification = new Notification();
 		notification.led.color = 0xFF0000;
 		notification.led.onTime =  1000;
 		notification.led.offTime = 500;
 		notification.led.repeatCount = 2;	
 		notification.vibrate.pattern = new long[] {100,200,100,200,100,200};		
 		notificationDevice.notify(notification);
        Throws:
        NotificationException - The exception will be thrown if the notification fails.

      • cancelNotification

        public void cancelNotification()
                        throws NotificationException
        This cancels the active notification from the device. 

         Example Usage:	 		
 		notificationDevice.cancelNotification();
        Throws:
        NotificationException - The exception will be thrown if the notification cancel fails.

      • release

        public void release()
             throws NotificationException
        Releases the notification device. You must release the notification device when you are done using it, so that internal resources can be freed up. Once you release, the notification device object will be unusable and you must use NotificationManager.getDevice() method to get a new notification device object. 

         Example Usage:
 device.release();
        Throws:
        NotificationException - The exception will be thrown if the notification device release fails.
